Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript SENTENCING HEARING (30 pages) commencing JULY 21, 2015 received and filed.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement received and filed.

Defendant Marcus Christopher Ward in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Marcus Christopher Ward in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing proceeds.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.     Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 20.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defense counsel requested a plea date.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea before Branch 20 on 6/25/15 at 1:30 p.m.

Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court, defendant Marcus Christopher Ward not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel waived his client's appearance. Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Same bail.

Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court, defendant Marcus Christopher Ward not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested another date. Case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 11:00 am.  File retained in court.

Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court, defendant Marcus Christopher Ward not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel in trial; requested another scheduling date.  File retained in court.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Original Transcript (18 pages) commencing 04/10/2015 PRELIMINARY HEARING received and filed.

Defendant Marcus Christopher Ward in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Marcus Christopher Ward in custody.  Kimberly Schoepp for Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Leo Carter-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with V.B. and K.C.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
